event.title: received a land grant from Spain in 1785

data.event: Alexander Fulton, a businessman from Washington County, near Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, received a land grant from Spain in 1785, and the first organized settlement was made at some point in the 1790s.

event.title: 1805, Fulton and business partner Thomas Harris Maddox laid out

data.event: In 1805, Fulton and business partner Thomas Harris Maddox laid out the town plan and named the town in Fulton's honor.

event.title: June 24, 1805 when a William Cochren who identifies

data.event: The earliest deed that survives, for an Alexandria resident is from June 24, 1805 when a William Cochren who identifies himself as a "of the Town of Alexandria" sold a tract of land across the Red River to a William Murrey.[Louisiana State Land Office, Historical Records, Sales Documents, South Western District, Sales Letters, 39].
